qas.question: What is the largest criticism leveled by consumers against Comcast
It has been alleged that Comcast's internet service has done what to customers?
What monopolistic practice draws criticism of Comcast?

answers.text: a lack of competition in the vast majority of Comcast's service area

qas.question: What dubious distinction has Comcast earned twice from The Consumerist?
How does Comcast's customer service stack up against its competition?

answers.text: often ranks among the lowest in the cable industry

qas.question: What year did Comcast first violate net neutrality?
What title was The Consumerist given in 2010 and 2014?
What company has the highest customer satisfaction in the US?
Antitrust concerns have been dismissed because COmcast does not own what company?
What type of definition does The Consumerist use?

context: <b7_0>Comcast<b7_0/> has been criticized for multiple reasons. The company's <a0_0>customer satisfaction<a0_0/> <a4_0>often ranks among the lowest in the cable industry<a4_0/>. Comcast <a1_0>has violated net neutrality practices<a1_0/> in the past; and, despite Comcast's commitment to a <b9_0>narrow<b9_0/> definition of net neutrality, critics advocate a definition of which precludes distinction between Comcast's private network services and the rest of the Internet. Critics also point out <a2_0>a lack of competition in the vast majority of Comcast's service area<a2_0/>; there is limited competition among cable providers. Given Comcast's negotiating power as a large ISP, some suspect that Comcast could leverage paid peering agreements to unfairly influence end-user connection speeds. Its ownership of both content production (in <b8_0>NBCUniversal<b8_0/>) and content distribution (as an ISP) has raised antitrust concerns. These issues, in addition to others, led to Comcast being dubbed <a3_0>"<b6_0>The Worst Company in America<b6_0/>"<a3_0/> by The Consumerist in 2014 and <b5_0>2010<b5_0/>.
